<b> Font position: </b> The font ought to line up symmetrically. Both "Gucci", and the "Made within Italy", should be perfectly centered inside label, and relative to one another. The GUCCI stamp should be centered perfectly above the Made in Italy, and the Made in Italy stamp should be centered perfectly within the label. Anything looking off-centered is a huge red flag, and strong evidence that the bag is replica designer.

<b> Brand Stitching: </b> The stitching which frames the label must also maintain perfect symmetry. Meaning the length from the stitch line to your labels edge should remain consistent on all sides of the brand. The stitches themselves should also be consistent, every last stitch being the identical length on all four sides with the label. If the stitch marks are crooked or in the event the stitches are erratic sizes, the handbag is most likely a replica designer Gucci.

This started the quarrels and arguments on who and ways to manage the then growing company. Despite their disputes, the brothers were successful at expanding "The Property of Gucci" and making it known in the international market.

The international popularity in the brand started when the idea established offices in other places like Ny. Movie celebrities helped really at putting Gucci with an international status symbol. These personalities posed as versions for Gucci shoes, shopping bags, accessories and other products in various lifestyle magazines worldwide. This boosted the reputation the firm in the international sector. Gucci continued enjoying phenomenal success in the 1970's.

Because of internal and familial quarrels, Gucci landed in rough roads inside 1980's. The brothers Rodolfo and Aldo who operated this company with equal shares continuously fought over the domination of the house of Gucci. The company then started out developing the accessories together with perfume division managed by Aldo while using the intention of putting the department on top of the best sales gainer and to get ahead of his brother. The aggressive selling of the perfumes and accessories caused Gucci's name to remain tarnished. The campaign cost the organization its place in that luxurious apparels industry along with the trust of many with its patrons. This was also combined with the rise of Gucci products imitations available, causing a considerable decline in the company's sales.
